name: ListIncidentAlerts
description:
Retrieve alerts for a specified incident.

Use this tool to list all alerts associated with a specific incident, which represents an issue that requires resolution. Useful for tracking and managing problems effectively.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the incident to retrieve alerts for.

parameters.name: use_versioning_header
parameters.description: Set the 'Accept' header for versioning. Specify the desired API version.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the media type for the request. Use 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of alert results per page for pagination.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: start_pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset for starting the pagination in search results. Use for navigating through paginated data.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: alert_deduplication_key
parameters.description: The unique key used for alert de-duplication.

parameters.name: filter_by_statuses
parameters.description: Filter alerts by specific statuses, such as 'triggered' or 'resolved'.

value_schema.description: Return only alerts with the given statuses. (More status codes may be introduced in the future.)

parameters.name: sort_incident_alerts_by
parameters.description: Specify the field and order for sorting alerts (created_at or resolved_at, with ascending or descending options).

value_schema.description: Used to specify both the field you wish to sort the results on (created_at/resolved_at), as well as the direction (asc/desc) of the results. The sort_by field and direction should be separated by a colon. A maximum of two fields can be included, separated by a comma. Sort direction defaults to ascending.

parameters.name: include_additional_details
parameters.description: Specify additional details to include, such as services, first_trigger_log_entries, or incidents.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: include_pagination_total
parameters.description: Set to `true` to include the total count of results in pagination responses for faster response times. Set to `false` for the default behavior of `null`, which is faster.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.
